EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Input Chest at Position(2.5, 17.5) serving as the factory interface  
– Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) with direction RIGHT (drop position at (4.5, 17.5))  
– Assembling Machine-1 at Position(1.5, 19.5) used for copper cable production

### Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Belt Depot Chest at Position(3.5, 15.5) that serves as the isolated belt target  
– Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest  
– Depot Burner Inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) with direction UP that interfaces with the depot  
Use-case: Provides a dedicated endpoint for receiving items from the extraction system

### Extraction System at Position(–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)  
– Associated Chest at Position(–3.5, 26.5) intended as a buffer/storage
Use-case: Retrieves items from the source (e.g. mined resources) and feeds them toward production

### Electricity Generator at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– Steam Engine (“Generator”) at Position(–0.5, 24.5)  
– Boiler at Position(–5.5, 24.0)  
– Offshore Pump at Position(–7.5, 25.5)
Use-case: Generates electricity using steam power (noting current warnings about lack of proper fluid input and network connection)

### Smelting Facility
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at Position(–3.0, 19.0) producing iron plates  
– Stone Furnace at Position(–4.0, 21.0) producing copper plates
Use-case: Processes raw materials into refined resources for further use

### Laboratory (Research Facility)
Consists of:
– Lab (electrical_id: 7106) accepting automation science pack inputs  
Use-case: Conducts research activities; currently flagged with no power

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Errors  
 – Issue: Repeated failures with “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target…”  
 – Tip: Always route transport belt connections through an inserter. Verify the target entity is not a steam engine before attempting to connect.

• Chest Placement Distance Error  
 – Issue: Failures when placing a wooden chest (e.g. at (3.5, 15.5)) because the target is too far from the player’s current position (player at (0, 0))  
 – Tip: Move closer to the intended placement position to satisfy the maximum placement distance requirements.

• Variable Naming Error  
 – Issue: “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined” indicating a mismatch in variable names  
 – Tip: Ensure that the variable names used (such as target_pos, target_place_pos, or depot_chest) are correctly defined and consistently referenced.
